job_title: Front-End Engineer, AWS SageMaker AI/ML Human-in-the-Loop, GT & A2I Consoles
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The Human-in-loop services team builds AWS services and applications that enable the use of human intelligence in Machine Learning. Common use cases include image, video labeling, 3d point cloud object detection and natural language processing. Successful machine learning models are built on high-quality training data. But the process to create the training data is often expensive, complicated, and time-consuming. Products such as SageMaker Ground Truth and Augmented AI solve the problem using smart crowd-sourcing and Machine Learning technologies thus improving the quality of the training data while reducing the cost.

We are looking for driven front-end engineers who are excited about our mission to bring Humans and Machines together and solve problems where ML/AI algorithms alone cannot solve the end to end problems. You will design and implement new features, architect new systems, coordinate with other teams, and drive engineering excellence. You will be responsible for improving the usability of Ground Truth Labelling and make them accessible and easy to use. You will use modern, open and closed source tools to deliver the best possible experience and help our customers quickly solve their problems. Ground Truth offers tremendous learning and growth opportunities with a diversity of challenges. Join our team and have an impact on the world by making ML more accessible than ever.

This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ideal candidates have extensive experience with agile methodologies of development, have a high team work mentality coupled with a strong bias for action yet always insisting on highest standards. That said, everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, wear many hats and work in a highly collaborative environment that feels more like a startup than a big company.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
Experience with modern programming languages and open-source technologies.
Experience with web/mobile technologies (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, React, WebPack, HTTP mechanics/performance).

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with modern front-end libraries and components such as React, Webpack, TypeScript, etc.
Experience with machine learning, deep learning, data mining, and/or statistical analysis tools is a plus.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A1755060

Overview

Do you have a passion for helping people create beautiful and engaging map-based data visualizations? Leverage your data visualization passion and technical knowledge to develop the next generation of storytelling tools used and loved by millions of people worldwide.

Join the ArcGIS StoryMaps team and help us build a new digital storytelling tool with unprecedented mapping capabilities. Authors around the world use story maps to drive change, influence opinion, and create awareness, with their stories getting millions of pageviews a day.

As a qualified candidate, you have a track record of contributing to successful outcomes for users and the business. You are a strong cross-functional partner, great communicator, and are able to take a solution from idea to implementation. You uphold a high standard of quality and have a strong appreciation for the details and understand the value of clear communication. Above all, you approach problems holistically and create elegantly simple solutions to multi-faceted problems.

Responsibilities

Own the mapping capabilities of the product--great opportunity to take leadership and define product features
Take on complex goals that push the boundary of the possible
Rapid prototyping to validate ideas and designs from designers
Create beautiful visualization along with good user experiences
Never compromise software design, quality, and performance

Requirements

3+ years of experience in front-end web app development
Hands-on experience with web technologies such as HTML5, ES6, TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS
Good understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as React
Deep understanding of WebGL and Canvas
Demonstrated technical ability for writing visualizations in JavaScript, Three.js, D3, or other visualization libraries as well as HTML, CSS
Good understanding of web, web performance, chrome tools, http, REST and JSON
Bachelor's or master's in computer science, journalism, GIS, or related field; or 5+ years of experience in related disciplines

Recommended Qualifications

Hands-on experience creating web-based mapping visualizations using mapping libraries such as ArcGIS API for JavaScript, Leaflet, Google maps
Exposure to ArcGIS REST API and feature services
Good understanding of UI/UX design techniques
Strong math skills and the ability to design and implement data structures leveraging non-trivial algorithms
Interest in compression techniques, real-time rendering, and the application of spatial data structures to create optimized 2D/3D content

Questions about our interview process?

About Esri

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.

job_title: Front End Engineer I - AWS Activate
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

The AWS Activate Program provides startups the resources they need to grow successfully on AWS. We do this by understanding the uniqueness of each and every startup that applies for Activate, and then personalizing the resources we make available to them. Our resources include (but are not limited to) AWS service credits, Business Support credits, technical education and training, opportunities for business and technical mentorship from Amazonians and startup peers, and personalized growth benefits. Above all else, Activate’s goal is to level the playing field for startup founders anywhere and everywhere. We believe that great ideas come from all types of founders, from all walks of life; not only those that have the good fortune of a venture investment.

AWS Activate welcomes all startup builders with open arms, and we’ll do our best to guide you through your journey, providing you with the relevant guidance, education and resources along the way. The AWS

Activate team is looking for a Frontend Engineer who wants to change the way we help Startups get started in AWS. We are obsessed with building tools and applications Startups need to be successful at AWS. We strive to bring new tools, features, and innovations to the Startup community. We are building applications that will use modern architectures, new services patterns, and exciting technologies to ensure we are meeting our customers expectations for performance, availability, and features. We value diversity in backgrounds and believe writing software is a learning process and that innovation is driven by learners, not knowers. As we deliver for our customer, we strongly encourage work-life balance; as well as, personal and professional growth. We are looking for motivated and skilled developers with the drive and enthusiasm to build ground-up applications for startups.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior engineers truly enjoy mentoring more junior engineers and engineers from non-traditional backgrounds through one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a well-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Our team puts a high value on work-live harmony. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (or related field) OR commensurate experience.
1+ years of professional software development experience
1+ years of experience with web/mobile technologies (e.g. JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, WebPack, HTML5, CSS), front-end frameworks (React, Angular, etc)

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree or higher preferred.
Proven success building high-performance and scalable systems.
Independent: ability to work with minimal direction with a strong sense of ownership.
Experience with Amazon Web Services is preferred.
Passion for customer experience and usability, including successful delivery of customer self-service tools and automated management/optimization of services, and a strong services orientation.
Experience developing application wireframes (e.g. Figma, Adobe) and mockups (e.g. HTML, CSS).
Proficiency in at least one back-end programming language, e.g. Java, Ruby, Python,, C#.
Understanding of CI/CD best practices.
Experience with Agile Scrum Methodologies.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.


Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Job ID: A1974348

CJ Affiliate is the world’s leading affiliate marketing network – and part of one of the world’s largest digital advertising company. We transform digital marketing with the help of big data to connect top advertisers and publishers.



About This Role



We are looking for a talented and experienced Lead Frontend Engineer to be at the center of the continuous evolution of CJ’s UI & UX. You will be closely collaborating with the Squad Leads, the Product Owners and the engineers.



This position will be responsible for the frontend development of CJ’s user interface ensuring an enhanced user experience, reusability, consistency, reliability, speed and security. The role requires strong technical leadership with sprinkles of hands-on development.



Responsibilities



Execute complex projects to add new functionality and improve the existing functionality of the core platform & 3rd party components.



Full project lifecycle: define & collaborate on requirements, offer solutions, discuss limitations, assess timelines, scoping and diagramming problems and solutions, communicate and discuss solutions with engineers and other stakeholders, maintain architecture diagrams and documentations, identify and eliminate redundancy.



Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code, architect efficient, reusable components and libraries.



Carry out issue resolution, troubleshooting, roots cause analysis, and implementation of solutions.



Conduct architectural, code quality and security standards review, via pair programming.



Develop and evolve the frontend stack, tools, libraries, in-house and 3rd party components.



Technical Leadership



Own the overall architecture, security, performance, and reliability of all applications’ frontend.



Lead architectural design discussions, and advocate for architectural design applications and implementation.



Daily check-ins with the engineers and the product owners.



Help the full-stack engineers remove any roadblocks they might have, work with them to predict possible future challenges and identify bottlenecks.



Review and improve existing standards, define, educate on and implement new standards.



Provide mentorship, identify improvement areas, define & implement a training process to constantly improve the frontend skills of the engineering organization.



Stay on top of the frontend technologies, threats and opportunities, what’s coming and going.









Qualifications



5+ years in a mature SaaS environment working with frontend technologies like React, Vue, Ember, or Angular.



Experience working with statically-typed languages like Typescript.



Experience with cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations.



Awareness of common web security vulnerabilities and how to avoid them.



Demonstrated ability to architect scalable and maintainable frontend JavaScript applications.



Deep understanding of browser JavaScript (including the DOM and platform APIs).



Experience with performance optimization and TDD



Experience developing server-side MVC applications, ideally Java/Spring based.



Flexible schedule for occasional early/late meetings with CJ’s global engineering teams.



Bachelor’s degree - CS or related field preferred; or related work experience.



Strong communication skills (verbal and written) – must be able to communicate at a business and technical level with internal teams, customers, partners and executives.









Additional Information



Why CJ Affiliate?



CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing. We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people. We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.



We're a community of creative and passionate problem solvers who go the distance to tackle the tough questions, think outside the box, and drive intelligent growth, for our clients—and ourselves. We foster and embody an inclusive and collaborative culture where diverse perspectives are sought, relationships are valued, and people feel accepted with a sense of belonging in expressing themselves authentically. We pride ourselves in having a workplace environment that values both work and play. Business Resource Groups, Fun team outings, office events, and flexible time off mean a work life balance with colleagues that turn into lifelong friends.



Conditions of Employment



All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.



Great People, Deserve Great Benefits



We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.



All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Stripe’s mission is to build the economic infrastructure for the internet. The Credit Detection team brings together machine learning with product development to lower Stripe’s credit risk at scale, while retaining a best in class user experience. Achieving this goal is critical to Stripe’s long term growth and profitability. We protect Stripe’s brand while also protecting the company from losses that can put our financial position at risk.

The Credit Intelligence team consists of machine learning, back end, and full stack engineers who want to tackle this problem through creative new ideas. We are exploring new areas and kicking off projects where you can have an outsized impact on the architecture, implementation, and design choices behind these systems.

As a software engineer you will be collaborating with other engineers on your team and across Stripe, as well as key partners in the product and risk org, data science, and operations.

Your Work Will Include

Building Stripe systems that interface with ML models to make credit decisions, and enact interventions and mitigations to protect Stripe from losses
Building ingestion pipelines or third party integrations for data that can be added as new signals to machine learning models
Proposing and implementing ideas that directly reduce Stripe’s credit exposure and losses
Working with engineers across the company to develop the right technologies for scaling our infrastructure
Debugging production issues across services and multiple levels of the stack

You May Be a Good Fit If You

Have 3+ years of software engineering experience
Write high quality code and hold yourself and others to a high bar when working with production systems
Take pride in taking ownership and working on projects to successful completion involving a wide variety of technologies and systems
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts
Are a quick study focused on making an impact and willing to put on many hats working on the full stack

At Stripe, we’re looking for people with passion, grit, and integrity. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Stripe, we strive for equity and inclusion and we welcome people who think rigorously and aren’t afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us.

Covid-19 Vaccine

About Guitar Center

The Guitar Center Company embodies the world of creativity and music by encouraging our teammates to find their own individual sound. Our mission is to develop and nurture lifelong musicians and make a difference in the world by enabling musicians and non-musicians alike to experience the joy that comes from creating music. We believe in putting our customers first, engaging with respect and integrity and fulfilling our mission with passion.

The Guitar Center Company operates through several business divisions. Guitar Center is the world's largest retailer of guitars, amplifiers, drums, keyboards, recording, live sound, DJ, and lighting equipment, with more than 290 stores across the United States.  2014 marked the milestone 50th anniversary of the Guitar Center Company as the organization continues to help people make music from coast to coast.   

E-Commerce brands Guitar Center, Musician's Friend and WWBW offer online sales of a broad selection of music products. The Music & Arts division operates more than 220 stores specializing in band & orchestral instruments for sale and rental, serving teachers, band directors, college professors, and students since 1952. AVDG and GCPro headline the enterprise audio-visual integration business, delivering a best-in-class commercial and residential customer experience.

Job description

Foldscope Instruments, Inc. is a Bay Area start up with the explicit mission to get scientific instruments into the hands of children around the world. Our first and flagship product is the Foldscope, a paper-based microscope that can be manufactured for about a $1. To date, we have distributed 1.4 million Foldscopes to over 150 countries around the world.

As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for designing classroom-friendly user interfaces and developing digital products for new scientific educational tools. This will involve collaborating with our engineering team, maintaining existing software, and helping integrate our online ecosystem, mobile application, and any digital or hardware products.

Salary Range: 65k-95k




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, design, or equivalent.
Proficiency in designing efficient and reusable front-end systems.
2+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6.
2+ years of HTML/CSS experience, including concepts like layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility.
Strong React and Node abilities.
A strong understanding of UI/UX principles, cross-browser compatibility, responsive web design, and general web functions and standards.
Possess home office environment with development PC and high-speed Internet connection.
Authorized to work in the U.S.

Preferred:

Knowledge of current web design trends and best practices.
Experience with MEAN and MERN.
Experience with Firebase.
Familiarity with SEO principles and ensuring application adherence.
Experience with Figma, Sketch, or Adobe Illustrator mockups.




Besides the primary job requirements, you will be expected to contribute to group meetings and brainstorming sessions for new product ideas and corporate strategy. Additional tasks may be required at the discretion of the CEO.




We believe that people with an affinity to our mission will be the best candidates for a position with Foldscope. You must believe in what we are trying to do and be willing to plunge full force into this job! We need sincere, personable people with integrity and spirit. If you have been in a professional programming role before, all the better, but it is not necessary if you have a thirst to use your skills to help reach children around the world with a new set of tools that will allow them to discover a whole new world. We hope you are a practical person with the basic skills to get things done. We trust that you will apply yourself fully to whatever tasks are required.

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Web Developer.

The web developer works on the various websites that our research center is operating and to develop HTML-based frontend interfaces for our in-house developed software tools and open-source platforms.The Web Developer will join our interdisciplinary team of medical imaging researchers at NYU Langone Health.

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) QuickSight is looking to hire talented frontend engineer to build world class experiences and services for our customers. AWS QuickSight is a fast, easy-to-use cloud-based, serverless Business Intelligence (BI) service designed for easy deployment to tens of thousands of users. As a fully-managed SaaS application, there’s no need to buy, manage and scale servers and no software to deploy and upgrade. QuickSight is deeply integrated with AWS data sources, allowing companies to deploy secure and scalable BI with their data on AWS.

You partner with UX designers, product managers, stakeholders and customers to build delightful user experiences for complex authoring and data visualization use cases. Additionally, you build fundamental frontend architectural components, including the design system, performance and accessibility frameworks utilized by larger frontend engineering community at QuickSight.

The ideal candidate will bring deep technical and leadership experience to work with team of rock star engineers to drive design and architecture decisions that impact long term vision. The decisions are crucial in how the customers around the world analyze and visualize data. If this sounds like a project you’ve been working towards and would like to deliver, please contact us today, and let’s talk about how you can be a part of it.

Key job responsibilities

Architect, design, develop and deploy new features for Amazon QuickSight
Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop highly innovative, consumer-facing experiences
Write clean, maintainable code and perform peer code-reviews.
Work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology, and evaluate technical feasibility.
Work in an agile / scrum environment to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules.
Establish architectural principles, select design patterns, and mentor team members on their appropriate application.
Help define and implement standards and promote best practices for the frontend development community including accessibility, performance, localization, scaling using micro-frontends etc

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

A day in the life

You would work hand in hand with dedicated designers and product managers to architect and deliver specific product features. This role is a mix of 70% hands on development and 30% leadership, collaboration and mentoring. You will be actively coaching other engineers directly or through code/design reviews to raise the bar on code development practices.

You will be able to assimilate research data and work with your manager/product manager/principal engineers to help define short and long terms vision.

You will have opportunity to leave a lasting thumbprint on solutions used by millions of users.

About The Team

We are a close knit and strong engineering team. It is a good mix of senior engineering talent to new grads. We have built strong frontend engineering talent in this team steadily. We are also supported by dedicated designers, product managers, UX and user researchers as well as SDETs. The team operates with autonomy and in a fast-paced startup-like setting.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math or related field and 3+ years of professional experience
Experience writing software in JavaScript, Java, React or similar frameworks
Experience developing software under UNIX/Linux environments.
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, OO design patterns, web application design and SOA
Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture/design/working software solutions.
Code and test system components; participate in code and design reviews.
Demonstrate ownership of end-to-end code quality, system tests, functional tests, and integration.
Partner/Collaborate across teams/roles to deliver results.
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, startup-like environment

Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of professional experience
Experience with responsive web design and the ability to deliver outstanding functionality across devices and platforms.
Experience with owning and maintaining high level of engineering operational excellence on applications in production at scale.
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries such as React/Redux
Experience building complex web-based applications utilizing strong design system adherence
Experience with building front end engineering platform stack for cross-team or cross product use
Experience with development on the AWS platform
Experience with data visualization software is a plus

About This Role

Description

About Aperio

At Aperio (part of BlackRock), our strategies are designed to put our clients’ and their clients’ interests at the center of our investment advice; to minimize costs and taxes; and to incorporate each client’s unique environmental, social, and governance (ESG) preferences. We are a purposefully growing quantitative/index-tracking investment management business specializing in managing customized equity portfolios tax efficiently.

At Aperio, we work hard and move quickly as a well-coordinated, collaborative team whose exceptional people are focused on providing extraordinary client service. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, industry-disruptive, fast-paced environment, Aperio is the place for you.

About This Role

The purpose of this role is to serve as a full stack software developer at the associate level. The focus of the position is developing web applications and working on other components of Aperio’s software systems. We are following the Microservices application architecture pattern using React on the front end and Python on the back end, so candidates can expect a lot of Python and JavaScript programming. Aperio practices Agile software development and works in two-week sprints. Therefore, this role will work closely with all other members of the Aperio technology team as well as members of our project management team and end users.

Key Responsibilities

Contribute to all phases in the life cycle of Microservices from interface definition to writing front-end and back-end code to handing them over for deployment in K8s cluster
Provide consistent improvements to Aperio’s enterprise fintech platform through modernization of current components and choice of contemporary technologies and enterprise third-party components
Write code that is easily understood by other team members
Keep up to date with developments in technologies Aperio is using

Indio Technologies, an Applied Systems company, is looking for a talented Front End Engineer who will help us innovate and shape our products and services as we continue to expand our offering. Our engineers are dedicated to transforming how insurance agents interact with clients and work in partnership with the rest of the organization to evolve our product. Along with excellent design and programming skills , the successful candidate will have the passion to challenge, extend and improve our existing frontend framework so that we can create exceptional user experiences across our platform .

Indio team offers a culture of constant learning and knowledge sharing . Our stack is based in Typescript and Angular , we are moving to React and GraphQL. Our backend end is built on Python/Django, and we continue to expand our toolbox to use the best technologies for the job .

What You Will Do

Assist with the development efforts of scalable, highly leverageable solutions that become part of the toolkit Indio needs so we can quickly and efficiently create delightful experiences .
Collaborate with the rest of the development group on the introduction of new technologies and best practices as needed to solve business problems .
Participate in product and feature discovery discussions .

What You Will Need To Be Successful
Remote Opportunity: Ability to work 100% remotely, or from an Indio office.
Must have:
2+ years of professional experience with a proven track record of building consumer or enterprise web applications and services
Programming skills developing using client-side JavaScript and HTML/CSS
Experience working with React/Redux . Alternatively , familiarity with other Single Page Application Frameworks
Experience working on Responsive design, MVC design patterns, ES6/7
Experience with Typescript and RxJs a plus
We welcome Full Stack experience and DB design
Strong understanding, building, and debugging of scalable, high-performance web applications built with reusability and componentization in mind .

We proudly support and encourage people with military experience, as well as military spouses, to apply

Join us as we expand our global footprint and do work that’s never been done. It’s an exciting time at Indio. You can do big things here, in an environment that supports innovation, teamwork, and collaboration. We’re changing the world and you can too.

Figma is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to make design accessible to all. Born on the Web, Figma helps entire product teams brainstorm, create, test, and ship better designs, together. From great products to long-lasting companies, we believe that nothing great is made alone—come make with us!

The Developer Experience team is responsible for making Figma’s engineers happy and productive. This team is responsible for the infrastructure, tools and processes to help accelerate the development workflows for entire Figma engineering. Specifically, this group is responsible for scaling and evolving Figma’s development environments, continuous integration/deployment pipeline as well as the general frameworks used by Figma engineers on a daily basis. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about solving engineering productivity challenges and have deep empathy for other developers.

The ideal candidate will have experience building and operating complex CI/CD pipelines at scale, and have experience coming up with solutions that work well at large scale. Additionally, they will have a passion and knack for building systems and tool for improving overall engineering productivity.

Check out this recent blog post for a deeper dive into Infra @ Figma!

This is a fulltime role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the continental United States.

What you’ll do at Figma:

Partner closely with the broader engineering team to develop scalable systems and tools that improves overall engineering productivity.
Take ownership and help dramatically improve development environment used by engineers daily.
Take ownership and improve Figma’s engineering standards, tooling, and processes around releasing code.


We'd love to hear from you if you:

Have 2+ years of experience building infrastructure components / services at scale. You have a proven grasp of Computer Science fundamentals and have a strong interest in distributed systems.
Are driven by impact. You are willing to work on grungy problems if they have a high impact on the business or the health of the infrastructure.
Care deeply about the quality of the software / systems you build. You have an artisan approach and are always looking to improve your craft. At the same time you are able to strike the right balance between idealism and pragmatism.
Have excellent problem solving skills. You use a systematic and thorough approach. You think from first principles. You have a bias for action.
Have excellent technical communication skills.
Finally, Figma is a close-knit company with a strong culture that promotes inclusivity and collaboration, taking ambitious goals and having fun doing so. You deeply value these traits and see yourself actively contributing to it.


At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

About Repay

REPAY (“Realtime Electronic Payments” / NASDAQ TICKER: RPAY) is an established and fast-growing publicly traded financial technology and payment processing company headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with offices across the country. REPAY offers a comprehensive suite of electronic payment and funding solutions, including debit and credit card processing, ACH processing, Instant Funding, and electronic bill payment systems with full IVR, text, and mobile capabilities. Who we are

The University of Arizona College of Medicine – Phoenix is much like the city it calls home, emerging. Your role

The University of Arizona College of Medicine – Phoenix is changing medicine by training physician leaders, making transformational discoveries and building healthy communities. The Marketing and Communications team is seeking a front-end web development Manager to oversee the development, management, maintenance, optimization and growth of the college's web presence. If you are an advanced front-end developer and have experience managing the Drupal content management system, we welcome your application to join our team!

The Manager of Web Development and Strategy helps people discover the college by leading all aspects of building, maintaining and updating the college's website in a Drupal environment. The person will bring a proactive work style with great design aesthetic and the ability to manage multiple, concurrent projects. description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Do you wake up in the morning excited about what cloud computing can do for customers of all shapes and sizes? Are you a passionate product manager who wants to help educate technical builders around the world? The AWS Developer Marketing Team is seeking a driven, talented, and experienced product manager to transform the way hands-on technical builder learn, experiment, and seek guidance on how to leverage AWS services.

You will have the opportunity to lead a team and define the strategy for how we help Developers, IT Professionals, systems engineers, cloud architects, and infrastructure engineers get started and learn how to leverage AWS. You will be responsible for defining the strategy and user experience for our builder focused web properties aimed at streamlining education and building community.

Ideally, you are someone that has experience building programs that foster deep, meaningful adoption of technology. You have an innate understanding of technical builders needs and how they make decisions to use technology. You are knowledgeable about current state-of-the-art cloud technologies and understand how they are driving change for ways that developers conceive, build, and operate systems. If you are passionate about helping developers innovate and create tomorrow’s amazing software, then this is the perfect role for you.

Key job responsibilities

Create a content strategy that ensures highly credible and effective messaging for AWS services that are used by builders from all backgrounds including developers, IT professionals, systems architects, DevOps engineers.
Create a compelling user experience that help educate builders on AWS

We’re looking for a Senior React Native Developer to lead the build of our iOS and Android app. As an early member of the team, this person will be responsible for end-to-end mobile application development and excited to take ownership (building, shipping and maintaining) of an application that is sure to change the landscape of individual and corporate giving. This role will work closely with the rest of the engineering team, product and design to spec-out, design and implement solutions for our end-users from version 1 and onward.




This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join a founding team aiming to create a solution to disrupt philanthropy and create world-wide impact. Tired of working at companies that are adding to society’s ills instead of solving them? Come contribute to our vision, a future where every solution is funded, and every problem is solved.




Groundswell is a new type of financial service that uses powerful technology for better giving. Our product allows companies to create personal foundations for its employees and match employee contributions straight from payroll, like a 401K for giving. Groundswell then provides users with access to all of the tools available to ultra-rich philanthropists: tax-free investments to grow your impact, matching to the best non-profits for the causes you care about, frictionless donations, a unified picture of your impact over time, and a single tax receipt at the end of the year. It puts employees in the driver's seat of corporate philanthropy and empowers them to create world-wide impact.




Our founding team has founded, sold, and IPO’d multiple companies totaling billions of dollars in enterprise value. We have deep experience building and selling products to both consumers and enterprises. Comment start The company has raised $15 million in seed funding, led by GV (Google Ventures) and capable of offering competitive pay, benefits, and equity packages.

We are firmly rooted in the belief that challenging problems are best solved in real time by highly cohesive teams.




We are excited to be back to work in office and building an incredible culture of connection and collaboration. The safety of our employees and their families is our top priority and we do require that all Groundswell employees working in the office are fully vaccinated.

Interested in leveraging your technical expertise and passion for progress for world good? Join us!




Responsibilities

Spend most of your time working in React Native to build user-facing features with top notch UI and UX.
Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining features.
Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels native.
Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
Perform code reviews for other engineers
Proactively identify areas for improvement and make recommendations for solutions within the code base.
Work closely with product and engineering teams to spec-out, design and implement user-facing features.
Understand and collaborate on complete product lifecycle from concept to execution.
Stay up to date with tech stack and industry trends, sharing knowledge and best practices with the team.




Skills and Requirements

5+ years recent experience building mobile apps with React Native
7+ years experience building consumer-facing client apps
Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field
Previous experience in early stage product design
Previous experience deploying both Android and iOS mobile apps
Partner with business and technology team members, to understand requirements and translate them into value-add technology solutions
Willingness to learn and expand skills and repertoire
A positive mindset, team-oriented, results-driven, and organized.




What We Value

We foster a high-trust culture. On our team things like integrity, trust, and respect are table stakes.
We embrace diversity. We value diversity not for its own sake but because we staunchly believe different experiences and perspectives will make us better. Oh, and we think diverse workplaces are simply more fun and interesting.
We value high competence, but low ego. Your pedigree isn’t what will earn you respect around here; your competence and humility will. It doesn’t matter to us whether you’re coming from the School of Hard Knocks or an Ivy League.
We believe we can change the world. If you don’t have an unabashed belief that you can make the world a better place, then you should go work at Amazon and help ship cat food faster.
We work smarter and harder. Our mission is too important and vision too bold to simply show up and mail it in. You must have an all-hands-on-deck attitude and sports team mentality.
We celebrate. We have fun. We want teammates that we are eager to see on Monday morning because they make our lives richer.
We never stop learning. We seek and give feedback, not for agreement or consensus, but to get to the best idea. Groupthink leads to Groupsink.

job_title: Front End Engineer - Amazon Forecast (AWS AI)
description:
Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Imagine never needing to hop from store to store during holidays because your first stop can anticipate the demand for the products they carry and stock up accordingly.

Imagine never having to wait too long or pay too much because your favorite ride-hailing service can account for weather or local events and direct enough drivers to your area.

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.

As a front-end engineer on the Amazon Forecast team, you will:

work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Key job responsibilities

Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions.
Build greenfield user experiences by incorporating diverse user requirements (e.g., accessibility, internationalization), user hardware constraints, and front-end security risks.
Improve and enhance the user experience for the customers of AWS AI services using latest front-end technologies.

A day in the life

You will use modern web-development tools and techniques including TypeScript, Node, React, Redux, CI/CD pipelines, Grunt, Webpack/Babel, Mocha/Jasmine/Jest, HTTP/2, and Git.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

About The Team

Amazon Forecast is a fully managed AWS AI service that uses machine learning to help companies achieve these goals by delivering highly accurate forecasts.

Our engineers and scientists continuously innovate so that our customers can keep up with the speed and scale of their business operations without the data science background or machine learning experience needed for generating highly accurate forecasts.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
2+ years of professional front-end development
Experience with modern programming languages (JavaScript, C#, or Python) and open-source technologies.
Skilled with common front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, TypeScript, Node, React

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building tools for data scientists or developers.
Attuned design sense so can collaborate with UX designers and hold a high bar with “backend” SDE's.
Experience with with CI/CD in a frontend context.
Experience establishing and leveraging web analytics.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.

Juno Diagnostics is a young startup in the women's healthcare space. We are building a platform that enables women to have easy and affordable access to prenatal care.

Juno is reimagining the way medical information is communicated to the patient and we are building a platform to make this goal a reality. We are now looking for a highly creative and flexible front-end web developer with an expertise in React and React technologies, who can put this vision into code. We are moving quickly and are very focused on execution. In this position you will have frequent communication with the team, but also the option of working remote. AKQA is an Equal Opportunities Employer, we believe that diversity is vital to AKQA’s ability to provide our clients with the best recommendations and are committed to fostering a varied and inclusive work environment. Who We Are

How exciting would it be to be a part of the innovation that goes into creating technology that delights millions of people in an industry that’s here to stay! And we are committed to a diverse and inclusive culture that will help our organization thrive! We seek diversity in many areas such as background, culture, gender, ways of thinking, skills and more. If you want to learn more about us visit us at www.panasonic.aero . And for a full listing of open job opportunities go to www.panasonic.aero/join-us/ .

Our Principles

Contribution to Society | Fairness & Honesty | Cooperation & Team Spirit | Untiring Effort for Improvement | Courtesy & Humility | Adaptability | Gratitude

What We Offer

At Panasonic Avionics Corporation we realize the most important aspects in leading our industry are the bright minds behind everything we do. We are proud to offer our employees a highly competitive, comprehensive and flexible benefits program.

We offer flexible remote work options depending on your role. Where possible, we offer fully remote or hybrid work opportunities.

This means that there is no fixed number, range, or limit to the amount of Personal and Vacation Days that may be taken for exempt employees. All employees receive 11 company paid holidays per year plus a paid company-wide shut down in the U.S. between Christmas and New Year.

job_title: Software Engineer, Frontend – Vision Automation (San Diego)
description:
The Role

Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team is currently seeking a frontend engineer that will own the web components of our computer vision platform for vehicle assembly and warehousing, our analytics and pattern recognition platform that governs Tesla’s purchasing decisions, or, depending on fit and opportunity, any one of a suite of apps this team is building that address the most difficult problems facing our growing Gigafactory network.

Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering team, in general, owns the centralized technical aspects of our multi-continent Gigafactory network and product line. The systems we work on include Tesla’s most important programs, such as Cybertruck, cell production, Robotaxi, and new factories globally. The software team is responsible for making these systems and operations every bit as intelligent and dynamic as the products themselves.

As a frontend software engineer on the Vehicle Engineering team, you will be in a product ownership role, leveraging whatever tech you feel fits best, e.g., React, graphQL, and/or websockets, to re-imagine what the global Gigafactory network should look like. Knowledge of both frontend frameworks and computer science fundamentals, like data structures and algorithms, are highly desired traits. The ideal candidates care foremost about the end-user experience, despite the issues that inevitably arise in complex industrial and scientific environments. The role will require the confidence to flex into design, backend, and network security, as needed, to make the final product successful.

Responsibilities

Deliver web applications that are useful to diverse groups, e.g. professional design engineers, program managers, production associates, and forklift drivers
Write reusable components with clean, modular patterns
Work closely with other software engineers to integrate with backend systems and solve networking problems
Work cross functionally with mechanical and design engineers to support evolving research projects and implement new features
Maintain and improve existing applications to better support the Vehicle Engineering team

Requirements

BS/MS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent industry experience
Working knowledge of the React framework
Proficiency with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience building streaming applications using, e.g., websockets
Expertise in debugging live software systems
Ability to demonstrate object-oriented, test-driven, and responsibility-driven design
Leadership experience in an engineering domain is a plus (not required)

Employee Benefits

As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents.
Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage)
3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution
Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage)
Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and employee discounts

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

You will be part of a team whose mission is to prototype, enhance, test and release new technologies to make quantum computers accessible to users around the world. As a Senior Frontend Developer, you get the things done while aiming at high-quality standards. You will collaborate with the IBM Quantum Cloud Team, a multi-disciplinary and global team of developers, designers, and researchers, to bring new features to life. If you are self-motivated, curious, and love to code, we have the right opportunity for you!

If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for this position is $118,000 to $161,000, based on a full time work schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For Part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted accordingly.

Must-Haves

Job Description

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Strategy and Integration, the Front-End Engineer is responsible for both supporting the development of new software applications and owning the creation, delivery & iterative improvement of UX (User Experience) deliverables. 




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 

To perform this job, an individual must perform each essential function satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. 




RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop software using Angular 8+ within team practices and guidelines
Create & deploy designs that enhance the user experience
Ensure applications are accessible across many platforms, including laptops and smartphones
Participate in interviews/discussions with users and stakeholders to understand user needs
Collaborate with entire Product Team to develop the overall look and design of the applications
Contribute to an inclusive, positive, improvement-oriented small-team dynamic
Operate as a self-starter who produces at a high-level consistently and without prompting

The Opportunity: You will work on concepts that will amaze you, work with a team that will inspire you, and help create products that truly add value to our users. Personal Capital’s WebUI team is agile and small, our data is rich and large, and this is your chance to be a member of this team and see your work make a significant impact not only on Personal Capital but also on the financial lives of our users.

The Candidate: You need to be a thinker and a doer. You need to be smart and build smart products. You need to be a perfectionist and really care for great user experience. You need to be a tester and always experiment with different concepts. You need to be ambitious: This is not an easy job. You will need to wear multiple hats, work with many unknowns, travel many unpaved roads to tackle large-scale problems. But it will be one of your finest work and creations, and an amazing engineering team is there to collaborate with you and support you.




The Work: As an engineer you will work on building modular, reusable front-end components.

Partner with leads to scope large cross functional projects, determine feasibility, and together, with the lead, manage the design and implementation.
Execute end-to-end software development in an agile environment including: requirements analysis, architecture, design, coding, testing, deployment, monitoring and support.
Come up with new ideas to improve our architecture and development process, get buy-in from the rest of the team, and put them into action.
Operate as a technical resource for other teams for best practices and provide advice, coaching, and education for other engineers.
Stay on top of technology and host tech talks for the team with proper points detailing how this could impact the technology organization.
Have a solutions mindset and bring about change by presenting proposals to solve problems, vs just highlighting problems.
Automate, Automate, Automate.




Qualifications:

Minimum of five years of software engineering experience, with at least threeyears on the front-end.
Demonstrable experience building world-class, consumer web application interfaces.
Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components.
Strong knowledge of JavaScript fundamentals and ES6.
Strong command of web standards, HTML, CSS, cross-browser compatibility, and accessibility.
Knowledge of modern front end tools such as React.js, Webpack, Enzyme, and Jest.
Working experience with browser APIs, and passion for optimizing front end performance.
Knowledge of client-side visualization libraries such as D3 is a bonus.
Experience with A/B testing and optimization is a plus.
Do it all attitude!
Bachelor's degree or higher, in Computer Science or a related field.

If you’re right for this position, you have solid knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (and applicable browser support) while being mindful of the diverse ecosystem of devices and connections. You've gained enough industry experience to have proven success leading project efforts while collaborating with teams. You care about and are eager to learn the details of deployment, commit history, refactoring, design patterns, and other development practices. You understand the value of design systems throughout the product design and development lifecycle and are willing to dig deep on this topic. You have a standards-centric view of the web, know its limitations and possibilities, and care about performance and progressive enhancement.




You will be expected to help craft solutions to client needs, recognizing the constraints of each unique situation. You’ll work with our team of designers and developers to turn those solutions into high-quality, well-tested websites and applications that are accessible to as many people as possible.




We're looking for applicants with at least some level of professional web development experience. If you haven't quite gained the professional experience needed to be a great fit for this particular Frontend Developer position, we recommend that you apply instead for our Full-Stack Developer Apprenticeship.




Requirements

We’re actively looking for individuals that will bring a diverse perspective to the Sparkbox office. Experience developing real-world web applications

Job Summary

DESCRIPTION

Interested in Machine Learning? As the SDE on the SageMaker UI team, you’ll get to work on:

The SageMaker Management Console (https://console.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker )

This is one of AWS' largest consoles, and we're not slowing down! The baseline requirement is to keeps parity with SageMaker's rapidly expanding HTTP API's, but we'll push to also develop unique experiences for SageMaker metadata that are only possible in a browser or mobile device. You own our webservers and the bytes they vend, including the design, testing, continuous deployment, operations, usage analytics, and customer support.

Custom UI/widgets for authoring and data scientist IDE experience. From a browser, we're making a highly scalable and collaborative data science workbench so a data scientist, developer, or student can launch a wholly configured and sharable workspace in the cloud.

Key Responsibilities

Work closely with senior engineers, UX designers, and product managers to develop friendly UI experiences.
Work closely with engineers to architect and develop the best technical design.
Develop/maintain operational rigor for the frontend of a fast-growing AWS service.
Collaborate with other SageMaker SDE's for features that cut across SageMaker.
Engage with customers and other AWS partners.
Help with hiring.

You'll be well supported by a group with deep technical chops, including multiple senior and principal engineers.

What is SageMaker?

Amazon SageMaker (https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/) is a fully-managed Machine Learning platform that makes it easy to build ML models, manage them, and integrate them with custom applications for batch or online predictions. SageMaker takes away the “heavy-lifting” normally associated with large-scale Machine Learning implementations so that developers and scientists can focus on the truly creative work of modeling and solving the business problem at hand.

About Us

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.


Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education
Professional experience in software development.
Experience with web/mobile technologies (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, NodeJS, React, WebPack, HTTP mechanics/performance).

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building tools for data scientists or developers.
Attuned design sense so can collaborate with UX designers and hold a high bar with “backend” SDE's.
Experience with with CI/CD in a frontend context.
Experience establishing and leveraging web analytics.
Machine learning knowledge and experience.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project.
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
Deep hands-on technical expertise in full-stack development.

Join our cast of characters as we work to change the way the world reads by building the world’s largest and most fascinating digital library: giving subscribers access to a growing collection of ebooks, audiobooks, magazines, documents, Scribd Originals, and more. In addition to works from major publishers and top authors, our community includes over 1.5M subscribers in nearly every country worldwide.

We’re defining the workforce of the future with Scribd Flex, a program that embraces multiple perspectives while leaning into our belief that no matter where each team member is, we trust them to accomplish our shared business goals. This program lets employees, in partnership with their manager, choose where they work while creating intentional in-person meetings with co-workers that build culture and connect us personally.

Remote employees must have their primary residence in: Arizona, California, Colorado, Delaware, DC, Florida, Hawaii, Iowa, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Washington, Ontario (Canada), and British Columbia (Canada).

This list may not be complete or accurate, and candidates should speak with their recruiter about their specific location for remote work.

About The Web Development Team

We’ve built a library of millions of books, audiobooks, magazine articles, sheet music collections, and user uploaded documents. 90% of millions of active users discover Scribd and continue to engage with content and build their libraries using our website. This team works across the stack with a strong focus on front end work.

We’re looking for diverse, well-rounded, communicative engineers to help empower our readers to indulge their curiosities and expand their knowledge by building quality products and user experiences. Our projects tend to be 1-2 front end engineers at a time, so faith, accountability, and excellent communication skills are extremely important.

Some Of Our Key Focus Areas

Responsive Web - desktop, tablet, phone – whatever device you have, we want you to be able to read!
Site speed - How fast is fast enough? Faster! Measure, optimize, repeat...
Accessibility - do you know what ARIA attributes are? Ever use a screen reader? We’re bringing Scribd up to WCAG level-AA to make reading work for folks who use assistive technology
Front end infrastructure - We strongly believe in code reuse and simplicity. We are working on shareable React component library and Design System to make our product development simple, fast and consistent.
SEO - with a library of millions of books, audiobooks and documents, search engine optimization is about a lot more than having a good sitemap.

About You

You're curious, humble, and interested in learning. You like and value people! You have good taste - you don't have to be a designer, but you should take pride in your work and want to make our app a beautiful, delightful reading experience

You Have

2+ years experience coding in a modern web stack -- eg. JavaScript, HTML, CSS -- on large scale, consumer-facing web applications
Good knowledge of modern JavaScript frameworks, preferably React.
Experience with continuous integration environments like Github, Jenkins, CircleCI , TeamCity etc.
Passionate about testing. Previous experience writing unit and integration tests with frameworks like Jest, Rspec, Enzyme, Cypress, Selenium, React Testing Library, etc.
Experience de-bugging issues in a complex modern web architecture which includes: distributed servers, CDN, image servers, databases, asynchronous web services, CSRF, cross site scripting, etc
Experience with Ruby on Rails or Python is a plus.

Benefits, Perks, And Wellbeing At Scribd

Healthcare Insurance Coverage: Scribd pays for employee’s Medical, Vision, and Dental premiums and a portion of dependent premiums
401k/RSP plans provided, plus company matching with no vesting period
Professional development: generous annual budget for our employees to attend conferences, classes, and other events
Quarterly Wellness, Connectivity & Comfort Benefit
Concern mental health digital platform
Free subscription to Scribd + gift memberships for friends & family
Leaves: 12 weeks paid parental leave, company paid short-term/long-term disability plans and milestone Sabbaticals
Generous Paid Time Off: Paid Holidays, Flexible Sick Time, Volunteer Day + office closure between Christmas Eve and New Years Day
Company-wide Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion programs which include learning & development opportunities, employee resource groups, and hiring best practices.

Want to learn more? Check out our office and meet some of the team at www.linkedin.com/company/scribd/life

Scribd is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

What You’ll Be Doing...

You will be responsible for developing Omni solutions that drive digital flow optimizations, store to digital integrations and apply best practices to ensure the customer experience is simple and easy to navigate through desktop and mobile platforms. Translate product and business goals into marketing strategy and roadmap

Ensure test scripts are run against code to ensure quality delivery
Address production code issues with business and senior peers with maximum urgency, as needed
Conduct root cause analysis and communicate to peers and management

Where You'll Be Working

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

You'll Need To Have

What we’re looking for...

Bachelor’s degree or one or more years of work experience.

Even Better If You Have

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or relevant discipline.
One or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in any full stack programming (react, angular, AEM), Java script, HTML and CSS.
Experience with business operations activities such as AEM content updates, promotions launch executions, device launch planning and execution, end to end customer journey experience validation
Experience applying best practices for SEO, Analytics, Omni tagging, Funnel reporting

Experience with managing multiple concurrent projects

Experience in programming with React JS, Redux
Experience in distributed systems development like Spring5 MVC.
Experience writing queries on NoSQL databases like Elastic.

Detail oriented abilities to ensure code meets user stories details.
